content: Click the System Menu and then click "Synaptic Package Manger": Then type gcc into the quick search box. The list may make take a moment to update. Then if you don;t have a blue box next to gcc like I have in the example then click the empty box and click "Apply" to install the gcc package.
title: Install a C++ Compiler in Ubuntu 9.04 Jaunty
name: install-a-c-compiler-in-ubuntu-9-04-jaunty

comments.author: Richard Hayes
comments.comment:
sudo aptitude install build-essential

This should also install the necessary files for both C and C++ compilers

Don't be afraid of the command line people, its often alot quicker
